# Output generated by @ua_chatgpt_bot

Ваше питання: How to convert jpeg to nv12 and store y and uv planes in separate files?

Відповідь: 1. Download and install the graphic software ImageMagick from the website https://imagemagick.org/index.php. 

2. Run the command line interface of the software, which will require you to enter parameters to complete the process if you are using a Windows platform.

3. Type in the command syntax which will convert the jpeg format to the nv12 format and split the format into two separate files – “y” and “uv”. The precise command syntax is: convert <inputfile.jpg> -colorspace yuv -sampling-factor 4:2:0 -separate NV12: <outputfilename>.uv <outputfilename>.y

4. Hit enter to execute the command. This will result in the conversion of the jpeg file to the nv12 format, and the splitting of the format into two separate files -"y" and "uv".
